SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange about the Corporate Announcement on formation of a JV for Haridwar City Gas Distribution ProjectConsortium of Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd (BPCL) and GAIL Gas Ltd (100% Subsidiary of GAIL India Ltd) has been awarded the authorization for laying, building, operating & expanding of a City Gas Distribution Network (CGD Network) in the Geographical Area of Haridwar District by the Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board established under the PNGRB Act, 2006.The authorization provides for a physical exclusivity for laying gas pipelines and related infrastructure in the GA over the next 25 years and a marketing exclusivity for 5 years. As per the Minimum Work Program Commitment prescribed by PNGRB, consortium shall lay 830 Inch KM of pipeline network and provide infrastructure for PNG domestic connection for 16,905 House Hold within five year of the grant of authorization. The Board has approved the proposal to form a new Joint Venture Company for laying, building and operating CGD network in Haridwar Geographical Area. The proposed JVC shall be a Company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, with equal equity participation from BPCL and GAIL Gas and equity stake of up to 10% for Government of Uttarakhand or its nominee.

Ltd has informed the Exchange that "On September 04, 2009 BPRL Ventures Indonesia B.V., an overseas wholly owned company held through Bharat PetroResources Limited (BPRL) which is wholly owned subsidiary of Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited ("BPCL") has framed into the Nunukan PSC in Indonesia, with a 12.5% participating interest which has been offered by M/s Anadarko Indonesia Nunukan Company ("Anadarko"), a wholly owned subsidiary of Anadarko Petroleum Corporation, U.S.A. The outlay as above includes BPRL's share of obligations previously agreed between Anadarko and Medco. The closing of the transaction under the Agreement is subject to normal conditions precedent in these kinds of transactions, including consent and waiver of first right of refusal by existing partners and subject to regulatory approvals of the Government of Indonesia. Upon closing, BPRL will acquire interest in the PSC and the JOA with effect from August 1, 2009. Videocon Indonesia Nunukan Inc. ("Videocon"), an overseas wholly owned subsidiary of Videocon Industries Limited has also farmed into the block on identical terms and conditions on the same day. Upon closing of the transaction, the Participating Interests held by the partners shall be as follows: Anadarko : 35.0%, Medco : 40.0%, BPRL : 12.5%, Videocon : 12.5%, Total : 100.0%". Ltd has informed the Exchange that by an Order made on the November 28, 2005, the Department of Company Affairs at New Delhi has directed that a Meeting of the Equity Shareholders of Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited, the Applicant Company be convened and held on January 16, 2006 for the purpose of considering, and if thought fit, approving with or without modifications, the Arrangement embodied in the Scheme of Amalgamation proposed to be entered into between Kochi Refineries Limited and Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited, the Applicant Company. A copy of the Notice convening the meeting of the equity shareholders shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Merger/Others
DETAILS: Bharat Petroleum Corpn. Ltd has informed the Exchange about the developments related to the proposal for merger of Kochi Refineries Ltd (KRL) with Bharat Petroleum corporation Ltd (BPCL) as follows: (1) The Joint Secretary, Ministry of Company Affairs vide his Order dated November 28, 2005 has - (a) directed KRL and BPCL to convene the EGM of the shareholders to consider the Scheme of Merger; (b) appointed Shri Ashok Sinha, C&MD, BPCL as Chairperson to conduct the EGM of the equity shareholders of BPCL and Mr. Justice Santosh N. Hegde (Retd) as Chairperson to conduct the EGM of KRL; (c) authorised the Chairpersons of the EGMs to fix the date, venue and time for the said meetings and (d) granted dispensation from holding the meetings of the Secured and Unsecured Creditors of KRL and BPCL. (2) The EGM of BPCL will be held on January 16, 2006.

SUBJECT: Record Date
DETAILS: Bharat Petroleum Corpn. Ltd has informed the Exchange that the BODs of the Company has fixed December 16, 2005 as the 'Record Date' for despatch of the notices of the EGM to be held as per the directions of the Dept. of Company Affairs to consider the Scheme of Merger of Kochi Refineries Limited with Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited.

SUBJECT: Investment

SUBJECT: Delisting of shares

SUBJECT: Book Closure
DETAILS: Bharat Petroleum Corpn. SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation
DETAILS: Bharat Petroleum Corpn. Ltd has informed the Exchange that the BOD's of the Company, at its meeting held on January 17, 2005, has approved the Scheme of Amalgamation of Kochi Refineries Limited with Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited. The BOD's has also recommended a swap ratio of 1: 2.25 i.e. four fully paid up equity shares of Rs.10/- each of Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited for every nine fully paid up equity shares of Kochi Refineries Limited. The above approval is however, subject to the necessary approvals of the Govt. of India, shareholders / creditors of BPCL / KRL and other Judicial / Regulatory authorities, as may be required under the applicable Laws.

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The press had reports that Bharat Petroleum Corpn. Ltd. is planning to merge the subsidiary company Kochi Refineries Ltd. with itself. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the press and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Bharat Petroleum Corpn. Ltd has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "We would like to clarify that as of date there is no such proposal before the Board of BPCL but due to probable synergies between the two companies, the matter is being re-examined at our end. In the event of firming up of any proposal in future on the same, we would be informing the Exchange".
